user_question: In the figure that has a tree shape, what is the name of the branch that has the least leafs?

solve_chains.step_target: Analysis：Identify the tree-shaped figure and its branches from available knowledge, and determine whether leaf node counts per branch are explicitly provided.

tool_calls.query: The tree-shaped figure is the RAG Technology Tree Evolution Diagram, with branches named Pre-Training, Fine-Tuning, and Inference. However, no explicit leaf node counts are provided for any of these branches, so it is not possible to determine which branch has the least leaves.
tool_calls.raw_answer: The tree-shaped figure is the RAG Technology Tree Evolution Diagram, with branches named Pre-Training, Fine-Tuning, and Inference. However, no explicit leaf node counts are provided for any of these branches, so it is not possible to determine which branch has the least leaves.
tool_calls.summary: The tree-shaped figure is the RAG Technology Tree Evolution Diagram, with branches named Pre-Training, Fine-Tuning, and Inference. However, no explicit leaf node counts are provided for any of these branches, so it is not possible to determine which branch has the least leaves.

solve_chains.step_target: Analysis：Examine the Summary of RAG Methods Table to extract all methods categorized under Pre-Training, Fine-Tuning, and Inference, and attempt to derive approximate leaf counts per branch based on listed methods.
Calculation：Count the number of methods explicitly assigned to each branch (Pre-Training, Fine-Tuning, Inference) from the extracted list to determine which branch has the least leaf nodes.
Integration：Synthesize the results to identify and name the branch with the least leaf nodes, noting any limitations in data precision.
